sentences.en: Boys are often more inhibited than girls about discussing their problems.
sentences.cn: 男孩子往往不如女孩子敢于谈论自己的问题。

sentences.en: Candid advice to the President by his colleagues is inhibited.
sentences.cn: 总统的同僚向他直言不讳地提供建议的渠道被阻塞了.

sentences.en: Cellular cleavage and proliferation was markedly inhibited.
sentences.cn: 细胞的分裂、增殖受到明显抑制。

sentences.en: Having been laughed at for his lameness, the boy became shy and inhibited.
sentences.cn: 那男孩因跛脚被人讥笑, 变得羞怯而压抑.

sentences.en: He seemed to have been inhibited in his work.
sentences.cn: 他的工作似乎已经被禁止了.

sentences.en: He was rather inhibited about discussing politics.
sentences.cn: 对于讨论政治他相当不自在.

sentences.en: His senses and reasons inhibited his wrong desires or impulses.
sentences.cn: 他的理智抑制了不正当的欲望或冲动.

sentences.en: It then inhibited their speech and made them acutely uneasy.
sentences.cn: 这样一来他们就说不了话,憋得难受.

sentences.en: Men are more inhibited about touching each other than women are.
sentences.cn: 触摸同性时男人比女人要更加拘谨。

sentences.en: No one should feel inhibited from taking part in the show.
sentences.cn: 任何人都不该觉得不好意思参加表演.

sentences.en: Officers will be inhibited from doing their duty.
sentences.cn: 官员们将无法履行职责。

sentences.en: She felt very inhibited by her own lack of experience.
sentences.cn: 她由于缺乏经验而感到很拘谨.

sentences.en: She was inhibited from making the decision to emigrate by the thought of her mother's loneliness.
sentences.cn: 她因担心母亲会感到孤独而不能作出移居国外的决定.

sentences.en: The doctor inhibited the patient from taking that medicine.
sentences.cn: 医生禁止病人吃那种药.

sentences.en: The fission of the cell could be inhibited with certain chemicals.
sentences.cn: 细胞的裂变可以通过某些化学药品加以抑制.

sentences.en: We are rather inhibited about touching each other.
sentences.cn: 我们对身体接触感觉很不自在。

trans.tran_cn: 拘谨的，压抑的，不自在的
